thread.title: BYU football: As expected, Cougars roll past hapless Wagner, 70-6
thread.title_full: BYU football: As expected, Cougars roll past hapless Wagner, 70-6

title: BYU football: As expected, Cougars roll past hapless Wagner, 70-6
text: BYU football: As expected, Cougars roll past hapless Wagner, 70-6 By JAY DREW | The Salt Lake Tribune First Published 1 minute ago • Updated 1 minute ago BYU running back Algernon Brown (24) drags Wagner linebacker Nick Menocal (17) on his way to a touchdown in the first half during an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Provo, Utah. (AP Photo/Rick Bowmer) BYU running back Algernon Brown (24) drags Wagner linebacker Nick Menocal (17) on his way to a touchdown in the first half during an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Provo, Utah. (AP Photo/Rick Bowmer) Share This Article ARTICLE PHOTO GALLERY (8) Provo • Freshman quarterback Tanner Mangum directed touchdown drives on BYU's first six possessions and the Cougars routed overmatched Wagner College 70-6 on Saturday at LaVell Edwards Stadium. BYU improved to 6-2 with the win and became bowl eligible for the 11th-straight season under coach Bronco Mendenhall. As expected, the matchup was lopsided from the opening kickoff, as BYU took a 28-0 lead in the first quarter and a 49-0 advantage at halftime. Mangum completed 12 of 13 passes for 237 yards and three touchdowns and staked BYU to a 42-0 lead before being replaced by fellow freshman Beau Hoge with eight minutes remaining in the first half. VIDEOS
